definition: to go onto the streets/to go shopping
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
street/CL:條|条[tiao2]
Shangjie District of Zhengzhou City 鄭州市|郑州市[Zheng4 zhou1 Shi4], Henan

sentences.english: In Egypt, there have been reports of street protests over the cost of tomatoes.
sentences.chinese: 在埃及也有報導過，因爲番茄價格而有人上街抗議。

sentences.english: Her plan to go shopping was nipped in the bud when visitors arrived unexpectedly.
sentences.chinese: 有客人突然來訪，使她上街購物的計劃落了空。

sentences.english: They will care for the sick, collect the rubbish, guard homes and offices, and give directions on the street.
sentences.chinese: 它們會照顧病人，收集垃圾，看家護院，上街指路。

sentences.english: Tracy: On the night of the festival, people go on streets with a variety of lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 元宵節的晚上，人們會提着各式各樣的燈籠上街。

sentences.english: Mrs May is out shopping, so we can be quite alone.
sentences.chinese: 梅夫人上街買東西了，我們正好可以安靜地談談。

sentences.english: With more popular use of credit cards and Octopus cards, do you bring less cash when going out?
sentences.chinese: 八達通及信用卡的普遍會否令你帶少了現金上街？

sentences.english: There were protests in the streets.
sentences.chinese: 工人有聯羣上街的行動。

sentences.english: Tunisians and, later, Egyptians took to the streets.
sentences.chinese: 突尼斯人及之後的埃及人紛紛上街表示不滿。

sentences.english: Then he went out for eight successive days with his rosette.
sentences.chinese: 接着，他天天帶上那小玫瑰紐上街，一連跑了八天。

sentences.english: Hundreds of people took to the streets to protest against police brutalities .
sentences.chinese: 數百名羣衆上街抗議警察的暴行。

sentences.english: Whenever in the street our dog is muzzled .
sentences.chinese: 每當上街時，我們的狗總是戴上嘴套。

sentences.english: Look out for the baby while I go shopping.
sentences.chinese: 我上街買東西時你要看好嬰兒。

sentences.english: So you are down the street and people know who you are..
sentences.chinese: 所以，如果你上街去，人們都知道你是誰。

sentences.english: Engzi's wife go, his son followed after crying to go.
sentences.chinese: 曾子的妻子上街去，他的兒子跟在後面哭着要去。

sentences.english: As he makes the half-turn onto the street, she waves to him.
sentences.chinese: 等到他上街轉彎時，她向他揮揮手。

sentences.english: One day, Zeng Zi's wife wanted to go to market.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，曾子的妻子要上街。

definition: on the street/in town
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
to take a walk/to window-shop/to stroll down the street
street
street/main street/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to go to town/to enter a big city (to live or work)
to go out/to go away (on a trip etc)
food market
to stroll
to set up a vendor's stall in the street
to stroll/to go for a walk
variant of 軋馬路|轧马路[ya4 ma3 lu4]
(dialect) to take a walk/to go for a stroll
to go to market/to go to a fair
to parade sb through the streets/to march or parade in the streets
to take a dog for a walk
